title: Diesel scrappage scheme being considered
description: The UK government's draft clean air plan has been dismissed as "toothless" and "weak" by critics.

title: US jobs growth rebounds in April
description: The number of jobs created in the US last month rose sharply, as the unemployment rate edged down.

title: Marks and Spencer names Archie Norman as new chairman
description: The former Asda boss and Conservative MP will replace Robert Swannell as chairman.

title: China's first big passenger plane takes off for maiden flight
description: The C919 aircraft is a key symbol of the country's ambitions to enter the global aviation market.

title: Johnson & Johnson ordered to pay $110m in US talc cancer case
description: A US woman says she developed ovarian cancer after 40 years using Johnson & Johnson talcum powder.

title: Uber faces criminal probe in US over 'greyball' code
description: The inquiry will look into Uber's use of software that helped it spot and avoid official scrutiny.

title: BA owner IAG hails record first-quarter profit
description: The group reports a 10% rise in profits and says bookings for its new long-haul airline are going well.

title: Santander faces challenge over fraud losses
description: A campaigner plans a group action to try to recoup losses by Santander customers caught out by fraudsters.

title: Delta Air Lines kicks US family off flight after row over toddler
description: Parents say they were threatened with jail and children with foster care for refusing to get off.

title: Oil price stabilises after earlier losses
description: Crude prices recover ground lost in early trade on Friday, but remain near five-month lows.

title: FTSE 100 steady as Pearson boosted by cost cutting plan
description: Shares in the education publisher jump as it announces plans for more cost cuts.

title: UK clean air strategy: Government to publish draft proposals
description: After a protracted legal battle, ministers are forced to reveal anti-pollution proposals.

title: Burberry to relocate 300 jobs from London to Leeds
description: The luxury brand said it plans to open a new business services centre in Leeds in October.

title: Shake Shack shares fall after sales go cold
description: The US burger and milkshake chain blames cold weather for driving away customers and hurting sales.

title: A tour of China's first big passenger jet - the C919
description: China hopes to rival Boeing and Airbus with the C919, its own commercial airliner.

title: Goldman Sachs draws up Brexit contingency plans
description: Goldman Sachs boss Lloyd Blankfein says banks might have a "smaller footprint" in London after Brexit.

title: Durban's 'one stop shop' DJ
description: The DJ who has built a thriving music and entertainment business in Durban, South Africa.

title: The Star Wars items worth a fortune
description: May the Fourth is Star Wars day to fans of the film. Since the first film was released 40 years ago, its makers have sold £25bn of merchandise.

title: Time to hand in your old paper five pound notes
description: Do you know old-style five pound notes cease to be legal tender at the end of this week?

title: What would your dream handbag look like?
description: A growing number of handbag-makers are offering customers the chance to design their own - what would your ideal bag look like?

title: Dashboard box encourages cleaner, smoother driving
description: A dashboard device called Lightfoot seeks to make people smoother, more fuel-efficient drivers. Dougal Shaw reports.

title: Bombay Sapphire: Canada recalls gin over too strong alcohol content
description: The Bombay Sapphire gin contained nearly twice the amount of alcohol stated on the bottles.

title: Adele earned £40m last year, says Sunday Times Rich List
description: The singer made £40m last year, taking her fortune to £125m, the Sunday Times Rich List says.

title: Watch me, watch me
description: Live streaming is becoming big business for 'creators' and tech firms alike. But is it dangerous?

title: Hello Arizona
description: Financial jobs in the US have finally rebounded. But they're not growing where you might think.

title: Move over Mulberry
description: More firms are now offering customers the chance to design their own handbags - we spoke to some of them about the soaring demand.

title: Scaling success
description: Salmon is Scotland's biggest food export, but what has driven its success?

title: Smart doggy
description: Tech for pets is a booming business, but will it simply encourage us to spend less time with them?

title: Battery bonanza
description: Could batteries help solve the renewable power problem?

title: Mr Fixer
description: Aaron Simpson and his company Quintessentially, a concierge services provider, organise many aspects of its clients' lives.

title: On the buses
description: The Greater Manchester mayor has the power to change an 'insane' bus system and put passengers first.

title: Hero's legacy
description: Twenty-three years after his tragic death, legendary F1 driver Ayrton Senna is still one of the most valuable brands in sport.

title: Trumponomics quiz
description: Test your knowledge of the first 100 days of Donald Trump's Presidency

title: No Bank balance
description: Deputy governor Charlotte Hogg leaves her post on Friday and its other top woman is off in June - why does the Bank struggle to find top women?

title: No branch?
description: Operators say that new technology means video ATMs will change the way we bank.

title: 'Pawternity' leave
description: From giving staff a week's paid leave to look after their new dog, to the firm that pays towards its employees' weddings.

title: Job opportunities
description: Uber launched in Egypt two years ago, and is now one of the company's fastest growing markets.

title: In the small print
description: Donald Trump is expected to announce a tax plan that would lower rates for businesses.

title: Hard tackling
description: From image rights to winding up orders, how HMRC has tackled the football industry.

title: Colour me
description: Working out what colour is going to be popular in future is crucial for industries across the world.

title: Email hell
description: When email goes wrong... how it can irritate and annoy everyone in the office.

title: Lunch-hour hacks
description: Rushed off your feet? Not enough hours in the day? Here are some apps to help you take control.

title: 'You're hired Mr Happy'
description: A profile of John Timpson, the boss of family-owned shoe repair firm Timpson, which has a very unusual recruitment policy.

title: Machine learning
description: Many people are unsure about what machine learning is, but the chances are they are using it every day.

title: Energy price cap
description: The Tories want a cap on energy prices - so what models might they choose from?

title: Geeks v government
description: The technology which underpins the internet's security has always been disputed.

title: Tory price promise
description: Suppliers and trade body Energy UK warn capping prices would eliminate competition in the sector.

title: Family matters
description: How wealthy your parents are is likely to matter more for young adults than it did for older generations.

title: Brand Masha
description: Russian tennis star Maria Sharapova returns to action next week looking to boost her sponsor appeal.

title: Packing a punch
description: Paul Singer's Elliott Management, famous for its pursuit of Argentine debt, is calling for shake-ups at several companies.

title: Braced for Brexit
description: Whether you consume music digitally or collect vinyl records, Brexit has the potential to affect you.

title: Key concerns
description: The regulator is concerned about the motor finance industry - so should car buyers also be worried?

title: Russia's secret
description: Stem subjects - science, technology, engineering, maths - have an image problem. But not in Russia.

title: Presidential challenge
description: France may have a high standard of living but there are some persistent economic problems that will prove a challenge to whoever becomes the next president.

title: The hippo at work
description: The problem of "hippos" in the workplace - and why it is important that their decisions can be openly questioned.
